thread.title: Virginia Wins First ACC Game 44-38 Over Syracuse in Triple Overtime
thread.title_full: Virginia Wins First ACC Game 44-38 Over Syracuse in Triple Overtime

title: Virginia Wins First ACC Game 44-38 Over Syracuse in Triple Overtime
text:
Virginia Wins First ACC Game 44-38 Over Syracuse in Triple Overt - NBC29 WVIR Charlottesville, VA News, Sports and Weather Member Center: Virginia Wins First ACC Game 44-38 Over Syracuse in Triple Overtime Posted: UVa won its first ACC game of the season 44-38 over Syracuse in triple overtime CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va (WVIR) - 
Cole Murphy missed a field goal in triple overtime and Jordan Ellis scored from three yards out to give UVa its first ACC and FBS win of the 2015 season, 44-38 over Syracuse. 
UVa's Matt Johns passed for 234 yards and two touchdowns in the 'Hoos win, including a 36 yard touchdown strike to Canaan Severin to tie the game 31-31 and send it into double overtime. 
Taquan 'Smoke' Mizzell racked up 127 total yards for two touchdowns. Mizzell's 13 yard touchdown run gave UVa a 38-31 lead over the Orange in the second overtime period. 
Virginia's Ian Frye hit a 25 yard field goal at the end of regulation to send the 'Hoos and Orange into overtime. 
Mike Moore forced a fumble that was recovered by Wilfred Wahee for a 32 yard fumble return, which gave UVa a 14-7 lead over Syracuse in the second quarter. 
The win over Syracuse is the Cavaliers' first over an ACC or FBS team since defeating Miami 30-13 in November of 2014. Virginia improved to 2-4 on the season and 1-1 in the ACC. The 'Hoos are now 2-6 all time when facing a new ACC foe for the first time. 
Virginia travels to Chapel Hill to face North Carolina next Saturday for a 3:30 kick off. Virginia Wins First ACC Game 44-38 Over Syracuse in Triple Overtime More>>
